contentrichtext.text: {{History of Japan|Shoso-in.jpg| Image explanation = [[Shōsōin]]}} {{nihongo|'''''Karyaku'''''|嘉暦}}, also romanized as '''Kareki''', was a {{nihongo|[[Japanese era name]]|年号,|''nengō'',|lit. "year name"}} after ''[[Shōchū (era)|Shōchū]]'' and before ''[[Gentoku]].'' This period spanned the years from April 1326 through August 1329.<ref>Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "''Karyaku''" in {{Google books|p2QnPijAEmEC|''Japan Encyclopedia'', p. 483|page=483}}; n.b., Louis-Frédéric is pseudonym of Louis-Frédéric Nussbaum, ''see'' [http://dispatch.opac.ddb.de/DB=4.1/PPN?PPN=128842709 Deutsche Nationalbibliothek Authority File].</ref> The reigning Emperor was {{nihongo|[[Emperor Go-Daigo|Go-Daigo]]''-tennō''|後醍醐天皇}}.<ref>Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). ''Annales des empereurs du Japon'', pp. 278-281; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). ''Jinnō Shōtōki.'' pp. 239-241.</ref> ==Change of era== * '''1326''' {{nihongo|''Karyaku gannen''|嘉暦元年}}: The new era name was created to mark an event or series of events. The previous era ended and the new one commenced in ''Shōchū'' 3. ==Events of the ''Karyaku'' era== * '''March 8, 1327''' (''Karyaku 2, 14th day of the 2nd month'')<!-- NengoCalc 嘉暦二年二月十四日 -->: There is a total eclipse of the moon.<ref>Xu, Zhentao ''et al.'' (2000). [http://books.google.com/books?id=9JatFvikiwQC&printsec=frontcover&dq=East-Asian+Archaeoastronomy:+Historical+Records+of+Astronomical+Observations+of+China,+Japan+and+Korea&client=firefox-a#PPA97,M1 ''East-Asian Archaeoastronomy: Historical Records of Astronomical Observations of China, Japan and Korea, '' p. 97.]</ref> ==Notes== {{reflist|1}} ==References== * Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric and Käthe Roth. (2005). [http://books.google.com/books?id=p2QnPijAEmEC&client=firefox-a ''Japan encyclopedia.''] Cambridge: [[Harvard University Press]]. 10-ISBN 0-674-01753-6; 13-ISBN 978-0-674-01753-5; [http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/58053128?referer=di&ht=edition OCLC 58053128] * [[Isaac Titsingh|Titsingh, Isaac.]] (1834). ''[[Nihon Odai Ichiran]]''; ou, [http://books.google.com/books?id=18oNAAAAIAAJ&dq=nipon+o+dai+itsi+ran ''Annales des empereurs du Japon.''] Paris: Royal Asiatic Society, Oriental Translation Fund of Great Britain and Ireland. [http://www.worldcat.org/title/nipon-o-dai-itsi-ran-ou-annales-des-empereurs-du-japon/oclc/5850691 OCLC 5850691] * [[H. Paul Varley|Varley, H. Paul]]. (1980). ''A Chronicle of Gods and Sovereigns: Jinnō Shōtōki of Kitabatake Chikafusa.'' New York: [[Columbia University Press]]. 10-ISBN 0231049404/13-ISBN 9780231049405; [http://www.worldcat.org/title/chronicle-of-gods-and-sovereigns-jinno-shotoki-of-kitabatake-chikafusa/oclc/6042764&referer=brief_results OCLC 6042764] * Xu, Zhentao and David W. Pankenier, Yaotiao Jiang. (2000). [http://books.google.com/books?id=9JatFvikiwQC&client=firefox-a ''East-Asian Archaeoastronomy: Historical Records of Astronomical Observations of China, Japan and Korea.''] London: CRC Press. 10-ISBN 90-5699-302-X; 13-ISBN 978-90-5699-302-3 == External links == * [[National Diet Library]], "The Japanese Calendar" [http://www.ndl.go.jp/koyomi/e/ -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection] <center> {| border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" |----- style="font-weight:bold;background-color:#CCCCCC;color:#000000;text-align:right" | Karyaku || 1st || 2nd || 3rd || 4th |----- style="background-color:#FFFFFF;" | [[Gregorian Calendar|Gregorian]] || 1326 || 1327 || 1328 || 1329 |} <center> {| border ="1" |----- | width ="30%" align ="center" | Preceded by:<br>''[[Shōchū (era)|Shōchū]]'' | width ="40%" align ="center" | '''[[Japanese era name|Era or ''nengō'']]:<br>Karyaku | width ="30%" align ="center" | Succeeded by:<br>''[[Gentoku]]'' |} {{Japanese era name}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Karyaku}} [[Category:Japanese eras]] {{Japan-era-stub}}
